metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1789 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The X509_cmp_time function in crypto/x509/x509_vfy.c in OpenSSL before 0.9.8zg, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0s, 1.0.1 before 1.0.1n, and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2b allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a crafted length field in ASN1_TIME data, as demonstrated by an attack against a server that supports client authentication with a custom verification callback.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1789` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.15
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.15').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
